name: Natural Labeling
speaker: Dorothy Clemmer, Maple Leaf Foods
description: Understand the ins and outs of Natural labeling.  Explore the differences between USDA and FDA definitions of “Natural”.  Discuss the impact on retail, restaurants and customer perception, and explore the pros and cons of this contentious claim.

name: Natural Labeling
speaker: Dorothy Clemmer, Maple Leaf Foods
description: Understand the ins and outs of Natural labeling.  Explore the differences between USDA and FDA definitions of “Natural”.  Discuss the impact on retail, restaurants and customer perception, and explore the pros and cons of this contentious claim.

name: Prepping for the New NFP
speaker: Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms
description: Soon, two final rules will be released by the FDA, forcing the largest change in nutrition labeling in 20 years.  Companies will need to decide to either re-label or reformulate their products.  Learn the specifics of the proposed rule (new formats, serving sizes, nutrients, vitamins & daily values) and what you can do to help your company prepare for this massive change.

name: Prepping for the New NFP
speaker: Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms
description: Soon, two final rules will be released by the FDA, forcing the largest change in nutrition labeling in 20 years.  Companies will need to decide to either re-label or reformulate their products.  Learn the specifics of the proposed rule (new formats, serving sizes, nutrients, vitamins & daily values) and what you can do to help your company prepare for this massive change.

name: Prepping for the New NFP
speaker: Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms
description: Soon, two final rules will be released by the FDA, forcing the largest change in nutrition labeling in 20 years.  Companies will need to decide to either re-label or reformulate their products.  Learn the specifics of the proposed rule (new formats, serving sizes, nutrients, vitamins & daily values) and what you can do to help your company prepare for this massive change.

name: Product Naming & Ingredient Labeling
speaker: Jesse Waller, Smithfield-Farmland     Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms
description: Explore USDA & FDA regulations on product naming & ingredients labeling.  Find out the difference between common, usual, descriptive, standard & fanciful names and what conventions are required for each.  Learn about the components of identity statements including many types of qualifiers. Discover the intricacies of declaring ingredients, including choosing a composite ingredient listing.

name: Product Naming & Ingredient Labeling
speaker: Jesse Waller, Smithfield-Farmland     Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms
description: Explore USDA & FDA regulations on product naming & ingredients labeling.  Find out the difference between common, usual, descriptive, standard & fanciful names and what conventions are required for each.  Learn about the components of identity statements including many types of qualifiers. Discover the intricacies of declaring ingredients, including choosing a composite ingredient listing.

name: Product Naming & Ingredient Labeling
speaker: Jesse Waller, Smithfield-Farmland     Justin Crews, Wellshire Farms  USDA-FSIS-LPDS staff
description: Explore USDA & FDA regulations on product naming & ingredients labeling.  Find out the difference between common, usual, descriptive, standard & fanciful names and what conventions are required for each.  Learn about the components of identity statements including many types of qualifiers. Discover the intricacies of declaring ingredients, including choosing a composite ingredient listing.

name: Allergen / Gluten Free Labeling
speaker: Penny Hennessey, Rich Products
description: Discover the different requirements of the USDA and FDA for labeling allergens, the major source of recalls in the United States.  Learn when allergens need to be declared and when they don’t, including the subtleties of containing statements.  Dive into the regulations on gluten free labeling and some considerations of its pros and cons.

name: Allergen / Gluten Free Labeling
speaker: Penny Hennessey, Rich Products
description: Discover the different requirements of the USDA and FDA for labeling allergens, the major source of recalls in the United States.  Learn when allergens need to be declared and when they don’t, including the subtleties of containing statements.  Dive into the regulations on gluten free labeling and some considerations of its pros and cons.

name: USDA Market Trends
speaker: Julie Leubbert, National Beef
description: Discover the latest innovations in USDA labeling.  From animal welfare claims to genetically engineered ingredients, you will delve into the subtleties of new trends and  how to manage the dialog with USDA-FSIS regulators.

name: USDA Market Trends
speaker: Julie Leubbert, National Beef
description: Discover the latest innovations in USDA labeling.  From animal welfare claims to genetically engineered ingredients, you will delve into the subtleties of new trends and  how to manage the dialog with USDA-FSIS regulators.

name: Food Service Labeling/ Sample Product Regulations
speaker: Teri Bello, Cargill
description: What are the differences between Food Service and retail?  If your company sends samples to customers or trade shows – what are the labeling requirements?  Dive into the different requirements for exterior and interior product labeling, best practices for claims and the labeling of experimental products.

name: Food Service Labeling/ Sample Product Regulations
speaker: Teri Bello, Cargill
description: What are the differences between Food Service and retail?  If your company sends samples to customers or trade shows – what are the labeling requirements?  Dive into the different requirements for exterior and interior product labeling, best practices for claims and the labeling of experimental products.

name: Nutrient/Health Claims
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants
description: Understand the FDA and USDA requirements for this very well defined set of claims. Dive into expressed versus implied claims, such as Lean, Low Fat, Sodium, and Omega claims, amongst others.  Explore relative claims and the “Healthy” claim, as well as FDA’s three types of Health claims.  Examine Front of Package nutrient claims and the subtleties of their different requirements.

name: Nutrient/Health Claims
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants
description: Understand the FDA and USDA requirements for this very well defined set of claims. Dive into expressed versus implied claims, such as Lean, Low Fat, Sodium, and Omega claims, amongst others.  Explore relative claims and the “Healthy” claim, as well as FDA’s three types of Health claims.  Examine Front of Package nutrient claims and the subtleties of their different requirements.

name: Nutrient/Health Claims
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants

name: Food Safety, Quality & Traceability
speaker: Rob Elder, Seaboard Farms
description: In this round table workshop, you will discuss best practices to insure the safety of your products.  Explore HACCP quality programs, support programs, reasons for recalls, and strategies for traceability.

name: Food Safety, Quality & Traceability
speaker: Rob Elder, Seaboard Farms
description: In this round table workshop, you will discuss best practices to insure the safety of your products.  Explore HACCP quality programs, support programs, reasons for recalls, and strategies for traceability.

name: GMO Labeling
speaker: Dorothy Clemmer, Maple Leaf Foods
description: GMO labeling is one of the fastest progressing and most controversial trends in labeling.  Explore the latest developments in this area, discover the difference between GMO and GEI, and discuss how the different regulatory jurisdictions of the USDA and FDA impact this labeling.

name: GMO Labeling
speaker: Dorothy Clemmer, Maple Leaf Foods
description: GMO labeling is one of the fastest progressing and most controversial trends in labeling.  Explore the latest developments in this area, discover the difference between GMO and GEI, and discuss how the different regulatory jurisdictions of the USDA and FDA impact this labeling.

name: FDA Market Trends
speaker: Penny Hennessey, Rich Products
description: Take a peek at the latest FDA labeling trends arriving on shelves. Distinguish those that are “bleeding edge” from those that are “leading edge”, and understand the subtleties of compliance and enforcement of FDA regulations.

name: FDA Market Trends
speaker: Penny Hennessey, Rich Products
description: Take a peek at the latest FDA labeling trends arriving on shelves. Distinguish those that are “bleeding edge” from those that are “leading edge”, and understand the subtleties of compliance and enforcement of FDA regulations.

name: Organic, Animal Production & Grading Claims
speaker: Josh Peters, Organic Valley
description: Discover the requirements for four different levels of organic claims, their documentation requirements and allowable organic logos.  Discuss the complexity of Animal Production and Breed Raising claims such as Cage-Free Poultry, Free-Range, No Added Hormones or Antibiotics, Humanely Raised, Certified Angus and others.  Find out the latest in USDA grading claims.

name: Organic, Animal Production & Grading Claims
speaker: Josh Peters, Organic Valley & Kristin Goodwin, USDA-FSIS-LPDS
description: Discover the requirements for four different levels of organic claims, their documentation requirements and allowable organic logos.  Discuss the complexity of Animal Production and Breed Raising claims such as Cage-Free Poultry, Free-Range, No Added Hormones or Antibiotics, Humanely Raised, Certified Angus and others.  Find out the latest in USDA grading claims.

name: EZ Form Software (Beginner)
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants
description: New to EZ Form? Discover how this powerful software can streamline your labeling process by providing required forms, labels and camera-ready Nutrition Facts Panels.

name: EZ Form Software (Beginner)
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants
description: New to EZ Form? Discover how this powerful software can streamline your labeling process by providing required forms, labels and camera-ready Nutrition Facts Panels.

name: Canadian vs. US Labeling
speaker: Robert DeValk, DeValk Consulting
description: Learn the basics of labeling requirements for Canada, including standardized products, nutrition labeling and bilingual labeling.  Discuss the subtleties of formulating products for Canada and some of the special issues that apply.  Understand what sources are available to help and what documentation is required for Canada.

name: Canadian vs. US Labeling
speaker: Robert DeValk, DeValk Consulting
description: Learn the basics of labeling requirements for Canada, including standardized products, nutrition labeling and bilingual labeling. name: USDA Labeling Q&A's
speaker: Celia Yau, Prime Label Consultants    Jill Konecnik, John Morrell
description: Explore the ins and outs of USDA labeling - such as product names & qualifiers; undefined RACC and nutrient claims; negative, uncured, organic and natural claims...  Bring your specific questions on the subtleties of labeling to our industry and PLC experts.

name: Nutrient Data: Lab vs. Calculation
speaker: Amy Hiller, Eddy Packing
description: Explore the integrity of the Nutrition Panel by understanding the differences between calculated and analytical methods of producing nutrient data.  Discuss the various sources of nutrient data, different classes of ingredients, and issues of nutrient variability.

name: Nutrient Data: Lab vs. Calculation
speaker: Amy Hiller, Eddy Packing
description: Explore the integrity of the Nutrition Panel by understanding the differences between calculated and analytical methods of producing nutrient data.  Discuss the various sources of nutrient data, different classes of ingredients, and issues of nutrient variability.

name: Clean Labeling
speaker: Curtis Rach, JRS
description: Discover best practices in clean labeling.  This workshop will explore how to clean up your labels and what makes a label “clean”.  These questions will be explored from an ingredient perspective.

name: Clean Labeling
speaker: Curtis Rach, JRS
description: Discover best practices in clean labeling.  This workshop will explore how to clean up your labels and what makes a label “clean”.  These questions will be explored from an ingredient perspective.

name: FDA Labeling Q&A's
speaker: Betty Campbell, EAS Consulting
description: Find out the answers to those nagging questions about your FDA labels.  From product naming to claims and allergens, your specific questions will be answered. Led by a former FDA regulator and senior FDA consultant.

name: FDA Labeling Q&A's
speaker: Betty Campbell, EAS Consulting
description: Find out the answers to those nagging questions about your FDA labels.  From product naming to claims and allergens, your specific questions will be answered. Led by a former FDA regulator and senior FDA consultant.

speaker: Betty Campbell, EAS Consulting

name: EZ Form Software (Advanced)
speaker: Fred Mosher, Prime Label Consultants
description: Now that you have mastered the basics of EZ Form, learn about its other powerful compliance tools.  These will include the calculators for Organic, Generic, Nutrient Claims, Child Nutrition, ADA Exchange and Country of Origin.  We will also review the Proposed NFP Change Report and the Spec Sheet Builder.

name: Generic Labeling Update
speaker: Jesse Waller, Smithfield-Farmland, Dr. Dan Engeljohn & Dr. Rosemary Earley, USDA-FSIS
description: Now that the expanded generic rule is one year old, find out the latest in requirements and best practices.  Explore generic eligibility and compliance, and discuss enforcement subtleties with your local inspector.  Understand what you need to do to keep thorough records and discuss strategies to reduce risk.

name: Generic Labeling Update
speaker: Jesse Waller, Smithfield-Farmland
description: Now that the expanded generic rule is one year old, find out the latest in requirements and best practices. name: Certified/Verified Claims
speaker: Rob Elder, Seaboard Foods & Jeff Waite, USDA-AMS, Tammie Ballard, USDA-FSIS-LPDS
description: Explore the intricacies of Certified/Verified Claims, including the certification process, documentation, types of claims and the subtleties of this labeling.

name: Flavor Labeling
speaker: Janice Howard, Southeastern Mills and Tawana Harrington, USDA-FSIS-LPDS
description: How you label a flavor depends upon which labeling jurisdiction applies.  Learn the ins and outs of this intricate subject and the differences between USDA and FDA flavor labeling.

name: Flavor Labeling
speaker: Janice Howard, Southeastern Mills
description: How you label a flavor depends upon which labeling jurisdiction applies.  Learn the ins and outs of this intricate subject and the differences between USDA and FDA flavor labeling.

name: Export to China, Mexico (Cuba…?)
speaker: Dr. Dan Engeljohn, Assistant Administrator USDA
description: Discover what you need to export product to three of the most interesting markets in the world: China, Mexico and Cuba.  Delve into the intricacies of labeling, customs requirements, and other important factors.

name: Export to China, Mexico (Cuba…?)
speaker: Dr. Dan Engeljohn, Assistant Administrator USDA
description: Discover what you need to export product to three of the most interesting markets in the world: China, Mexico and Cuba.  Delve into the intricacies of labeling, customs requirements, and other important factors.

name: School Lunch (CN) Labeling
speaker: Staff of USDA-AMS CN group
description: Discover the ins and outs of Child Nutrition labeling from the administrators themselves.  Explore how CN labeling works and its advantages.  Step through a CN label application and discuss whole grain rich criteria.  Finally, find out where to obtain information and discuss some frequently asked questions.
